bugs.title: CVE-2019-12221 SDL: null-pointer dereference in function SDL_free_REAL in stdlib/SDL_malloc.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12221 SDL: null-pointer dereference in function SDL_free_REAL in stdlib/SDL_malloc.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12221 SDL: null-pointer dereference in function SDL_free_REAL in stdlib/SDL_malloc.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in libSDL2.a in Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) 2.0.9 when used in conjunction with libSDL2_image.a in SDL2_image 2.0.4. There is a SEGV in the SDL function SDL_free_REAL at stdlib/SDL_malloc.c.

Reference:
https://bugzilla.libsdl.org/show_bug.cgi?id=4628

Created SDL tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1732251]
The bug is in SDL2_image component. Not in SDL component. I moved the bug there. Please be more careful when filing bugs.

Created SDL2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1752605]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1752603]


Created mingw-SDL2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1752606]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1752604]

Statement:

This issue did not affect the versions of SDL as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7, and 8 as they did not include SDL2_Image add-on.

Upstream patch:
https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL_image/rev/e7e9786a1a34

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-12221

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an

this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated

Wrong component. Moving to SDL2_image.
FEDORA-2019-a6bc0fb143 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 29. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-a6bc0fb143

SDL2_image-2.0.5-2.fc29 has been pushed to the Fedora 29 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-a6bc0fb143

bugs.title: CVE-2019-12216 SDL: heap-based buffer overflow in function SDL2_image function IMG_LoadPCX_RW in IMG_pcx.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12216 SDL: heap-based buffer overflow in function SDL2_image function IMG_LoadPCX_RW in IMG_pcx.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12216 SDL: heap-based buffer overflow in function SDL2_image function IMG_LoadPCX_RW in IMG_pcx.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in libSDL2.a in Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) 2.0.9 when used in conjunction with libSDL2_image.a in SDL2_image 2.0.4. There is a heap-based buffer overflow in the SDL2_image function IMG_LoadPCX_RW at IMG_pcx.c.

Reference:
https://bugzilla.libsdl.org/show_bug.cgi?id=4619

Created SDL tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1732253]

Statement:

This issue did not affect the versions of SDL as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7, and 8 as they did not include SDL2_Image add-on.

Upstream fix:
https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL_image/rev/7453e79c8cdb

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-12216

Created SDL2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1752610]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1752607]


Created mingw-SDL2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1752609]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1752608]

bugs.title: rabbitmq crash dump generating on all the controllers every minute

bugzilla.short_desc: rabbitmq crash dump generating on all the controllers every minute

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Rabbitmq crash dump is getting generated every minute.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
Red Hat OpenStack Platform 13 

How reproducible:
Always

Actual results:
Rabbitmq generating crash dump

Expected results:
rabbitmq should not crash.

Additional info:
We patched heat_api and heat_engine containers with patches mentioned in RHBZ#1747226 Not sure if they are related in any case.

Looks like a duplicate of bug 1699993

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1699993 ***

bugs.title: CVE-2019-12221 SDL2: SDL: null-pointer dereference in function SDL_free_REAL in stdlib/SDL_malloc.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12221 SDL2: SDL: null-pointer dereference in function SDL_free_REAL in stdlib/SDL_malloc.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12221 SDL: null-pointer dereference in function SDL_free_REAL in stdlib/SDL_malloc.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in libSDL2.a in Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) 2.0.9 when used in conjunction with libSDL2_image.a in SDL2_image 2.0.4. There is a SEGV in the SDL function SDL_free_REAL at stdlib/SDL_malloc.c.

Reference:
https://bugzilla.libsdl.org/show_bug.cgi?id=4628

Created SDL tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1732251]
The bug is in SDL2_image component. Not in SDL component. I moved the bug there. Please be more careful when filing bugs.

Created SDL2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1752605]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1752603]


Created mingw-SDL2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1752606]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1752604]

Statement:

This issue did not affect the versions of SDL as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7, and 8 as they did not include SDL2_Image add-on.

Upstream patch:
https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL_image/rev/e7e9786a1a34

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-12221
